Appendix C: Digital Antinets 附录 C：数字反网络
---------------------------------------

sometimes people contact me and write Scott, thank you! I finally understand how the Zettelkasten is supposed to work! These reactions are typically found in the YouTube comments on my videos. Yet every so often I get people who follow up this praise with some excuse. They insist analog won’t work for them. For instance, they complain about their bad handwriting. Or they object to keeping a notebox due to their work environment.[909](#footnote-882) Naturally, they follow this up with the question of How can I implement the Antinet digitally? 有时人们联系我并写信给斯科特，谢谢！我终于明白 Zettelkasten 应该如何工作了！这些反应通常可以在 YouTube 对我的视频的评论中找到。然而，我经常会遇到一些借口跟进这种赞美的人。他们坚持认为模拟对他们不起作用。例如，他们抱怨自己的笔迹不好。或者，由于他们的工作环境，他们反对保留一个记事箱。909 自然地，他们接着问我如何以数字方式实施 Antinet？

In brief: you can’t. 简而言之：你不能。

Well, you can’t without sacrificing various benefits, that is. 好吧，你不能不牺牲各种好处，就是这样。

But… 但…

If you put a gun to my head and told me to build a digital Antinet, here’s what I would do: 如果你拿枪指着我的头让我建立一个数字 Antinet，我会这样做：

First, I wouldn’t do it. 首先，我不会这样做。

Now with that out of the way, we can move on to the second thing I’d do. 现在有了这个，我们可以继续我要做的第二件事。

The second thing I would do would be to add a character limit to notes. I did a rough count of the character space on 4 x 6 inch notecards (or the equivalent, a6 paper). I estimate the character space to be roughly 825 characters. 我要做的第二件事是为笔记添加字符限制。我粗略地计算了 4 x 6 英寸记事卡（或等效的 a6 纸）上的字符空间。我估计字符空间大约为 825 个字符。

Here’s one of my notecards, word-for-word: 这是我的一张记事卡，逐字逐句：

When you strip away “contiguity” in the system, thus leaving a pile of leaves, you dismantle the mind of the system. You destroy the system’s memory and its unique way in understanding things. You’ve turned your communication partner into a pile of leaves! See: ‘4212/2b5’当你剥离系统中的 “连续性”，从而留下一堆叶子时，你就拆除了系统的思想。你破坏了系统的记忆和它理解事物的独特方式。你把你的通讯伙伴变成了一堆树叶！参见：‘4212/2b5’

“Shared meaning” of items that are also located nearby one another (forward associations, backward associations, and nearby associations) “play a crucial role in the function of human memory,” according to one scholar who specializes in the field. 一位专门研究该领域的学者表示，同样位于彼此附近的项目的 “共同意义”（前向联想、后向联想和邻近联想）“在人类记忆的功能中起着至关重要的作用”。

In other words, note the important distinction: it’s the stemlinks & branchlinks which play a crucial role in how human memory works—not just remote links. Digital Zettelkastens do not possess the first two. 换句话说，请注意重要的区别：在人类记忆的工作方式中发挥关键作用的是主干链接和分支链接——而不仅仅是远程链接。 Digital Zettelkastens 不具备前两者。

(Kahana, 11)（卡哈纳，11 岁）

Here’s a photo of it: 这是它的照片：

This card comes out to 738 characters (excluding the card address). Also there’s some extra room at the top. 这张卡总共有 738 个字符（不包括卡地址）。顶部还有一些额外的空间。

Here’s one of Luhmann’s notecards, word-for-word: 这是卢曼的一张记事卡，逐字逐句：

Im Grunde führt also die Als-Struktur des Erkennens auf das System. Denn etwas kann nur erkannt werden durch Hinweis auf ein anderes, das wiederum in weiteren Zusammenhängen bedeutsam ist. Und das Gewicht, das die Feststellung von etwas als etwas hat, empfängt sie von diesen anderen Zusammenhängen her, auf die sie verweist. Sobald solches Feststellen begrifflich wird, wird es daher auch systematisch.Im Grunde führt als-Struktur des Erkennens auf das System。 Denn etwas kann nur erkannt werden durch Hinweis auf ein anderes, das wiederum in weiteren Zusammenhängen bedeutsam ist。 Und das Gewicht, das die Feststellung von etwas als etwas hat, empfängt sie von diesen anderen Zusammenhängen her, auf die sie verweist。 Sobald solches Feststellen begrifflich wird, wird es daher auch systematisch。

Vgl. auch Schlick, S. 62: “Das Erkenntnisurteil ist einen neue Kombination von lauter alten Begriffen. Die letzteren kommen in zahllosen anderen Urteilen vor, von denen uns einige (z.B. ihre Definitionen) schon vorher bekannt sein mussten; sie bilden die Verbindungsglieder, durch die das Neue in das grosse System der bekannten Urteile eingeordnet wird, welches den Bestand unserer ErfahrungenVgl。 auch Schlick, S. 62：“Das Erkenntnisurteil ist einen neue Kombination von lauter alten Begriffen。 Die letzteren kommen in zahllosen anderen Urteilen vor, von denen uns einige (z.B. ihre Definitionen) schon vorher bekannt sein mussten; sie bilden die Verbindungsglieder, durch die das Neue in das grosse System der bekannten Urteile eingeordnet wird, welches den Bestand unserer Erfahrungen

Here’s a picture of this card: 这是这张卡的图片：

photo credit: “Niklas Luhmann-Archiv,” accessed May 5, 2022, [https://niklas-luhmann-archiv.de/bestand/zettelkasten/zettel/ZK_1_NB_8-5-1_V](https://niklas-luhmann-archiv.de/bestand/zettelkasten/zettel/ZK_1_NB_8-5-1_V). 照片来源：“Niklas Luhmann-Archiv”，2022 年 5 月 5 日访问，https://niklas-luhmann-archiv.de/bestand/zettelkasten/zettel/ZK_1_NB_8-5-1_V。

This comes out to 797 characters. 结果是 797 个字符。

Again, there’s some white space in both of these cards. Plus, I’m not counting the card addresses. For these reasons, I think a character limit of 825 is a good guesstimate. 同样，这两张卡片中都有一些空白。另外，我没有计算卡地址。由于这些原因，我认为 825 个字符限制是一个很好的估计值。

If I were forced to build a digital Antinet, the third thing I’d do is this: I’d disable editing and deleting. Once a note is created it should not be edited or deleted. Yet, appending other ideas onto the note is fine. Such additions can be in the form of adding text to any blank space. For example, adding ‘See Also’-cardlinks. This would be like a pop-up bubble seen when hovering your mouse over an image. For instance, there are design collaboration apps that allow designers to add pop-out text over areas of the design as a comment bubble over the image. 如果我被迫构建一个数字 Antinet，我会做的第三件事是：我会禁用编辑和删除。注释一旦创建，就不应被编辑或删除。然而，将其他想法附加到笔记上是可以的。此类添加可以采用向任何空白区域添加文本的形式。例如，添加 “另见” 卡片链接。这就像将鼠标悬停在图像上时看到的弹出气泡。例如，设计协作应用程序允许设计人员在设计区域上添加弹出文本，作为图像上的评论气泡。

The fourth thing I’d do if forced to build a digital Antinet relates to the directory structure. There would be three top level structures, corresponding to the three boxes of an Antinet: (1) Bibliography Box, (2) Index Box, and (3) Main Box). It would be look like this: 如果被迫构建数字 Antinet，我会做的第四件事与目录结构有关。将有三个顶层结构，对应于 Antinet 的三个框：(1) 书目框，(2) 索引框，和 (3) 主框）。它看起来像这样：

The fifth thing I would do if forced to build a digital Antinet would be to eliminate the ability to copy and paste. 如果被迫构建数字 Antinet，我会做的第五件事是消除复制和粘贴的能力。

The sixth thing I would do would be to delete tags and backlinks from the system. 我要做的第六件事是从系统中删除标签和反向链接。

The seventh thing I would do is delete the search box. This forces users to deliberately create keyterms in the index. It also forces one to navigate the Antinet in a more exploratory way. 我要做的第七件事是删除搜索框。这迫使用户故意在索引中创建关键字。它还迫使人们以一种更具探索性的方式在 Antinet 中导航。

The final thing I would do would be to delete the whole digital repository and get back to creating knowledge the analog way! 我要做的最后一件事是删除整个数字存储库并重新以模拟方式创建知识！

Ironically, one of the individuals who, early on, claimed analog wasn’t an option for them ended up changing their stance. They tried building out the Antinet the right way (the analog way), and they’ve since come to see the light. 具有讽刺意味的是，其中一个早期声称模拟不是他们的选择的人最终改变了他们的立场。他们尝试以正确的方式（模拟方式）构建 Antinet，从那以后他们就看到了曙光。

I believe the majority of those who claim that analog isn’t for them simply possess false beliefs. If they would only test it first themselves, they’d come to realize the advantages of analog. 我相信大多数声称模拟不适合他们的人只是持有错误的信念。如果他们只是先自己测试一下，他们就会意识到模拟的优势。

Still, everyone’s different. I’m not some analog luddite. Try both for yourself. If you decide analog doesn’t do it for you, then hopefully the guidelines I’ve laid forth in this section will be of service to you. 不过，每个人都不一样。我不是什么模拟勒德分子。自己尝试一下。如果您认为模拟不适合您，那么希望我在本节中提出的指南对您有所帮助。

Oh, and one last thing: don’t do digital. 哦，最后一件事：不要做数字。

Glossary 词汇表
------------

Analog Knowledge Development (“AKD”): A term for those who develop knowledge using analog tools. Knowledge development refers to four phases: (1) selecting sources of knowledge and the material within those sources; (2) extracting interesting thoughts from books, podcasts, videos, and other media; (3) creating notes that elaborate on the thoughts one extracts from knowledge sources; (4) installing those thoughts into a long-term storage structure so that the thoughts may evolve (the Antinet Zettelkasten being the ultimate storage structure). 模拟知识开发（“AKD”）：使用模拟工具开发知识的人的术语。知识开发指的是四个阶段：（1）选择知识来源和这些来源中的材料； (2) 从书籍、播客、视频和其他媒体中提取有趣的想法； (3) 创建笔记，详细说明从知识来源中提取的想法； (4) 将这些思想安装到长期存储结构中，以便思想可以进化（Antinet Zettelkasten 是最终的存储结构）。

Antinet: A notebox containing four core properties (or principles): Analog, Numeric-Alpha Card Addresses, a Tree Structure, and an Index. Together, these four principles create a cybernetic thinking network. Variant terms: Antinet Zettelkasten, Analog Zettelkasten, Luhmannian Zettelkasten.Antinet：包含四个核心属性（或原则）的记事本：模拟、数字字母卡地址、树结构和索引。这四个原则共同创建了一个控制论思维网络。变体术语：Antinet Zettelkasten、Analog Zettelkasten、Luhmannian Zettelkasten。

Antinetter: Those who develop knowledge using the Antinet. These are the crazy ones, the crazy few. Those who know, deep-down, that developing their thoughts using analog tools (and specifically the Antinet Zettelkasten) is the most magical, powerful, intimate way of creating meaningful output.Antinetter：那些使用 Antinet 开发知识的人。这些是疯狂的人，疯狂的少数人。那些内心深处知道使用模拟工具（尤其是 Antinet Zettelkasten）发展思想是创造有意义输出的最神奇、最强大、最亲密的方式。

Bibliography Box (“Bib Box”): A box in the Antinet which stores all of your bibcards (notes from the books you read). These bibcards are stored alphabetically by author’s last name.Bibliography Box（“Bib Box”）：Antinet 中的一个盒子，用于存储您所有的 bibcards（您阅读的书籍中的注释）。这些 bibcards 按作者姓氏的字母顺序存储。

Bibliography Card (“Bibcard”): A 4 x 6 inch notecard oriented vertically. This card is used to store observational thoughts with a corresponding page number while reading (or engaging with other sources like podcasts, videos, lectures, etc.). Also useful as a bookmark. Variant terms: Staging Card, Literature Notes. 参考书目卡（“Bibcard”）：一张 4 x 6 英寸的垂直记事卡。此卡用于在阅读（或与播客、视频、讲座等其他来源互动）时存储具有相应页码的观察想法。也可用作书签。变体术语：临时卡、文献注释。

Bibliography Notes (“Bib Notes”): These are short, observational notes from readings (or other media), which are placed on bibcards. They begin with a page number, and then a very brief observation or thought. The bib notes are then transformed into more in-depth notes (called main notes). 参考书目注释（“Bib Notes”）：这些是来自阅读（或其他媒体）的简短观察注释，放在 bibcard 上。它们以页码开头，然后是非常简短的观察或想法。围兜笔记然后被转换成更深入的笔记（称为主要笔记）。

Bubble Graph Boiz: Digitally-obsessed PKM individuals who spend their days majoring in the minor. These folks obsess over metadata tags, and creating interesting templates for creating notes. The one thing they do not prioritize is knowledge development. Nor do they prioritize output. You can find these individuals hanging out in your favorite PKM software’s forums. Variant terms: Workflow Warriors, Digital notetaking Junkies, Hotkey Addicts, Plugin Perverts.Bubble Graph Boiz：痴迷于数字化的 PKM 个人，他们每天都专注于未成年人。这些人痴迷于元数据标签，并创建有趣的模板来创建笔记。他们没有优先考虑的一件事是知识发展。他们也不优先考虑产出。您可以在您最喜欢的 PKM 软件论坛中找到这些人。变体术语：Workflow Warriors、Digital notetaking Junkies、Hotkey Addicts、Plugin Perverts。

Card Address: The numeric-alpha notecard address affixed to the top-left or top-right of each notecard (e.g., 4214/5a/1). 卡片地址：贴在每个记事卡左上角或右上角的数字字母记事卡地址（例如 4214/5a/1）。

Cardlink: Within a notecard, when you reference another card address in your Antinet, you’re effectively creating a cardlink. For instance, when you find the following card address placed within the main area of a notecard (not in the top-left or top-right), you’re creating a cardlink (e.g., 4214/14). Cardlinks aren’t like digital links. They’re hard to create. Cardlinks are hardlinks (this is a good thing)! 卡片链接：在记事卡中，当您在 Antinet 中引用另一个卡片地址时，实际上是在创建一个卡片链接。例如，当您发现以下卡片地址位于记事卡的主要区域（而不是左上角或右上角）时，您正在创建一个卡片链接（例如 4214/14）。卡片链接不像数字链接。他们很难创造。卡片链接是硬链接（这是一件好事）！

Collectives: A notecard with a list of keyterms, phrases or cardlinks to other cards in the Antinet. Variant terms: Hubs, Hub Notes, Structured Notes, Maps of Content.Collectives：一张记事卡，其中包含一系列关键术语、短语或指向 Antinet 中其他卡片的卡片链接。变体术语：中心、中心笔记、结构化笔记、内容地图。

External References (ExRefs): References to external sources outside of the Antinet. For instance, a reference to a specific book and page number (Scheper, Scott. Antinet Zettelkasten, p. 122). Variant Terms: External Links. 外部引用 (ExRefs)：对 Antinet 之外的外部资源的引用。例如，对特定书籍和页码的引用（Scheper, Scott. Antinet Zettelkasten, p. 122）。变体条款：外部链接。

Hoplink Cards: Very simple cards that contain a brief snippet of text that say something like: For more on x concept, see cardlink ‘xxxx/xx/x’. These cards enable one to quickly hop to other relevant places in the Antinet.Hoplink 卡片：非常简单的卡片，包含一小段文字，内容如下：有关 x 概念的更多信息，请参阅卡片链接 “xxxx/xx/x”。这些卡片使人们能够快速跳转到 Antinet 中的其他相关位置。

Index: A box within the Antinet containing keyterms and corresponding cardlinks in the Antinet. Variant Terms: Index Box, The Index, Register, Keyword Register. 索引：Antinet 中的一个框，其中包含 Antinet 中的关键字和相应的卡片链接。变体术语：索引框、索引、寄存器、关键字寄存器。

Indexcards: Notecards placed in the index, which enable you to navigate to different areas of the Antinet (by way of cardlinks and a human-readable keyterm). 索引卡：放置在索引中的记事卡，使您能够导航到 Antinet 的不同区域（通过卡链接和人类可读的关键字）。

Keyterm: A human-readable concept that points you to a numeric-alpha address (cardlink) in the main box of your Antinet.Keyterm：一个人类可读的概念，它将您指向 Antinet 主框中的数字字母地址（卡片链接）。

Keyterm Indexcards: A keyterm indexcard, as opposed to a list indexcard, is a dedicated card listing multiple links or external references for a given keyterm. Whenever a keyterm entry in a list indexcard accumulates multiple cardlinks, you’ll want to create a dedicated keyterm indexcard for it.Keyterm Indexcards：Keyterm 索引卡，与列表索引卡相反，是一张专门的卡片，列出给定关键字的多个链接或外部参考。每当列表索引卡中的关键字条目累积多个卡片链接时，您需要为其创建一个专用的关键字索引卡。

List Indexcards: Indexcards filed alphabetically, each pertaining to one letter of the alphabet (A, B, C, etc.). Under the assigned alphabetical character is a list of keyterms that begin with the letter affixed to the card. 列表索引卡：索引卡按字母顺序归档，每个索引卡与字母表中的一个字母（A、B、C 等）有关。在分配的字母字符下方是一系列以贴在卡片上的字母开头的关键词。

Main Box: The main part of your Antinet containing the main types of notecards with numeric-alpha addresses affixed to them. These cards follow the tree-like branching structure of the Antinet. 主盒：Antinet 的主要部分，包含主要类型的记事卡，上面附有数字字母地址。这些卡片遵循 Antinet 的树状分支结构。

Maincards (“Cards”): The main types of notecards stored in your Antinet (in the main box). Maincards are 4 x 6 inch (or a6) horizontal notecards (preferentially white and blank). They contain a numeric-alpha card address affixed to the top-left, or top-right, of the notecard. Maincards contain one of the four types of main notes. Variant terms: Cards, Notecards.Maincards（“卡片”）：存储在 Antinet（在主箱中）中的主要类型的记事卡。 Maincards 是 4 x 6 英寸（或 a6）水平记事卡（最好是白色和空白）。它们包含贴在记事卡左上角或右上角的数字字母卡片地址。 Maincards 包含四种类型的主要笔记之一。变体术语：卡片、记事卡。

Main Notes: The types of notes you’ll find on maincards. These four note types are observation notes, excerpt notes, reformulation notes, and reflection notes. 主要注释：您可以在主卡上找到的注释类型。这四种笔记类型是观察笔记、摘录笔记、重构笔记和反思笔记。

Neuroimprinting: The concept of more effectively stamping an idea onto your mind for later recall done by way of writing by hand. 神经印记：通过手写的方式更有效地将一个想法印在脑海中以便日后回忆的概念。

Personal Knowledge Management (“PKM”): A Personal Information Storage System used by digital apps, which enables one to link documents (of typically low-processed information). Otherwise known as a procrastinator’s wet dream. 个人知识管理（“PKM”）：数字应用程序使用的一种个人信息存储系统，它使人们能够链接文档（通常是低处理信息）。否则被称为拖延者的梦遗。

Remotelinks: Say you’re writing a note within the card 4214/5a/2 and you create a link to the card 1334/2a/4. What you have just created is a remotelink. You’re linking to a remote area of a card in your tree of knowledge (your Antinet). Remotelinks are essentially the full card address of another card that reside in a more remote part of your Antinet (relative to the location of the card referencing it). 远程链接：假设您在卡片 4214/5a/2 中写了一条笔记，并创建了一个到卡片 1334/2a/4 的链接。您刚刚创建的是一个远程链接。您正在链接到知识树（您的 Antinet）中卡片的远程区域。远程链接本质上是另一张卡的完整卡地址，该卡位于 Antinet 的更远程部分（相对于引用它的卡的位置）。

“See Also” Cardlinks: Oftentimes, you don’t need to create a dedicated hoplink card to navigate around your Antinet. You can just append relevant cardlinks to already developed cards. This is where “See Also” Cardlinks come in handy. These are snippets of text at the bottom of cards that say something like, See also: “xxxx/xx/x.”“另请参阅”卡片链接：通常，您不需要创建专用的跳链接卡片来浏览您的 Antinet。您可以将相关的卡片链接附加到已经开发的卡片上。这就是 “另见” 卡片链接派上用场的地方。这些是卡片底部的文本片段，内容类似于“xxxx/xx/x”。

Wikilinks: Cheaply created digital links to other notes (usually markdown files). Wikilinks are typically created with text enclosed in two square brackets (e.g., [[I’m a Useless Link to a Digital Note]]).Wikilinks：廉价创建的指向其他笔记的数字链接（通常是降价文件）。 Wikilinks 通常是用两个方括号括起来的文本创建的（例如，[[I'm a Useless Link to a Digital Note]]）。

About The Author 关于作者
---------------------

scott p. scheper, aka “The Analog Knowledge Revolutionary,” is a writer, copywriter and marketer residing in San Diego, California. When not communicating with his Antinet (“Stewie”), one may find Scott communicating with an actual human being. Actually, probably not. One is more likely to find Scott reading a book with a bibcard sticking out of it. Keep in touch with Scott, and join his highly entertaining private email list, by visiting his website: [https://scottscheper.com](https://scottscheper.com/). 斯科特页 scheper，又名 “模拟知识革命者”，是居住在加利福尼亚州圣地亚哥的作家、撰稿人和营销人员。当不与他的 Antinet（“Stewie”）交流时，人们可能会发现斯科特与一个真实的人交流。实际上，可能不是。人们更有可能发现 Scott 正在读一本书，书上贴着一张名片。通过访问他的网站，与 Scott 保持联系并加入他非常有趣的私人电子邮件列表：https://scottscheper.com。
